2920/**
2921 * _base_display_ioc_capabilities - Disply IOC's capabilities.
2922 * @ioc: per adapter object
2923 *
2924 * Return nothing.
2925 */
2926static void
2927_base_display_ioc_capabilities(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
2928{
2929 int i = 0;
2930 char desc[16];
2931 u32 iounit_pg1_flags;
2932 u32 bios_version;
2933
2934 bios_version = le32_to_cpu(ioc->bios_pg3.BiosVersion);
2935 strncpy(desc, ioc->manu_pg0.ChipName, 16);
2936 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: FWVersion(%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d), "\
2937 "ChipRevision(0x%02x), BiosVersion(%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d)\n",
2938 ioc->name, desc,
2939 (ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0xFF000000) >> 24,
2940 (ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0x00FF0000) >> 16,
2941 (ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0x0000FF00) >> 8,
2942 ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0x000000FF,
2943 ioc->pdev->revision,
2944 (bios_version & 0xFF000000) >> 24,
2945 (bios_version & 0x00FF0000) >> 16,
2946 (bios_version & 0x0000FF00) >> 8,
2947 bios_version & 0x000000FF);
2948
2949 _base_display_OEMs_branding(ioc);
2950
2951 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "Protocol=(", ioc->name);
2952
2953 if (ioc->facts.ProtocolFlags & MPI2_IOCFACTS_PROTOCOL_SCSI_INITIATOR) {
2954 pr_info("Initiator");
2955 i++;
2956 }
2957
2958 if (ioc->facts.ProtocolFlags & MPI2_IOCFACTS_PROTOCOL_SCSI_TARGET) {
2959 pr_info("%sTarget", i ? "," : "");
2960 i++;
2961 }
2962
2963 i = 0;
2964 pr_info("), ");
2965 pr_info("Capabilities=(");
2966
2967 if (!ioc->hide_ir_msg) {
2968 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
2969 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_INTEGRATED_RAID) {
2970 pr_info("Raid");
2971 i++;
2972 }
2973 }
2974
2975 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities & MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_TLR) {
2976 pr_info("%sTLR", i ? "," : "");
2977 i++;
2978 }
2979
2980 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities & MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_MULTICAST) {
2981 pr_info("%sMulticast", i ? "," : "");
2982 i++;
2983 }
2984
2985 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
2986 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_BIDIRECTIONAL_TARGET) {
2987 pr_info("%sBIDI Target", i ? "," : "");
2988 i++;
2989 }
2990
2991 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities & MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_EEDP) {
2992 pr_info("%sEEDP", i ? "," : "");
2993 i++;
2994 }
2995
2996 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
2997 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_SNAPSHOT_BUFFER) {
2998 pr_info("%sSnapshot Buffer", i ? "," : "");
2999 i++;
3000 }
3001
3002 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
3003 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_DIAG_TRACE_BUFFER) {
3004 pr_info("%sDiag Trace Buffer", i ? "," : "");
3005 i++;
3006 }
3007
3008 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
3009 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_EXTENDED_BUFFER) {
3010 pr_info("%sDiag Extended Buffer", i ? "," : "");
3011 i++;
3012 }
3013
3014 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
3015 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING) {
3016 pr_info("%sTask Set Full", i ? "," : "");
3017 i++;
3018 }
3019
3020 iounit_pg1_flags = le32_to_cpu(ioc->iounit_pg1.Flags);
3021 if (!(iounit_pg1_flags & MPI2_IOUNITPAGE1_NATIVE_COMMAND_Q_DISABLE)) {
3022 pr_info("%sNCQ", i ? "," : "");
3023 i++;
3024 }
3025
3026 pr_info(")\n");
3027}
3028
3029/**
3030 * mpt3sas_base_update_missing_delay - change the missing delay timers
3031 * @ioc: per adapter object
3032 * @device_missing_delay: amount of time till device is reported missing
3033 * @io_missing_delay: interval IO is returned when there is a missing device
3034 *
3035 * Return nothing.
3036 *
3037 * Passed on the command line, this function will modify the device missing
3038 * delay, as well as the io missing delay. This should be called at driver
3039 * load time.
3040 */
3041void
3042mpt3sas_base_update_missing_delay(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
3043 u16 device_missing_delay, u8 io_missing_delay)
3044{
3045 u16 dmd, dmd_new, dmd_orignal;
3046 u8 io_missing_delay_original;
3047 u16 sz;
3048 Mpi2SasIOUnitPage1_t *sas_iounit_pg1 = NULL;
3049 Mpi2ConfigReply_t mpi_reply;
3050 u8 num_phys = 0;
3051 u16 ioc_status;
3052
3053 mpt3sas_config_get_number_hba_phys(ioc, &num_phys);
3054 if (!num_phys)
3055 return;
3056
3057 sz = offsetof(Mpi2SasIOUnitPage1_t, PhyData) + (num_phys *
3058 sizeof(Mpi2SasIOUnit1PhyData_t));
3059 sas_iounit_pg1 = kzalloc(sz, GFP_KERNEL);
3060 if (!sas_iounit_pg1) {
3061 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "failure at %s:%d/%s()!\n",
3062 ioc->name, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__);
3063 goto out;
3064 }
3065 if ((mpt3sas_config_get_sas_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply,
3066 sas_iounit_pg1, sz))) {
3067 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "failure at %s:%d/%s()!\n",
3068 ioc->name, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__);
3069 goto out;
3070 }
3071 ioc_status = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCStatus) &
3072 MPI2_IOCSTATUS_MASK;
3073 if (ioc_status != MPI2_IOCSTATUS_SUCCESS) {
3074 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "failure at %s:%d/%s()!\n",
3075 ioc->name, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__);
3076 goto out;
3077 }
3078
3079 /* device missing delay */
3080 dmd = sas_iounit_pg1->ReportDeviceMissingDelay;
3081 if (dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_UNIT_16)
3082 dmd = (dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK) * 16;
3083 else
3084 dmd = dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK;
3085 dmd_orignal = dmd;
3086 if (device_missing_delay > 0x7F) {
3087 dmd = (device_missing_delay > 0x7F0) ? 0x7F0 :
3088 device_missing_delay;
3089 dmd = dmd / 16;
3090 dmd |= MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_UNIT_16;
3091 } else
3092 dmd = device_missing_delay;
3093 sas_iounit_pg1->ReportDeviceMissingDelay = dmd;
3094
3095 /* io missing delay */
3096 io_missing_delay_original = sas_iounit_pg1->IODeviceMissingDelay;
3097 sas_iounit_pg1->IODeviceMissingDelay = io_missing_delay;
3098
3099 if (!mpt3sas_config_set_sas_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply, sas_iounit_pg1,
3100 sz)) {
3101 if (dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_UNIT_16)
3102 dmd_new = (dmd &
3103 MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK) * 16;
3104 else
3105 dmd_new =
3106 dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK;
3107 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "device_missing_delay: old(%d), new(%d)\n",
3108 ioc->name, dmd_orignal, dmd_new);
3109 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "ioc_missing_delay: old(%d), new(%d)\n",
3110 ioc->name, io_missing_delay_original,
3111 io_missing_delay);
3112 ioc->device_missing_delay = dmd_new;
3113 ioc->io_missing_delay = io_missing_delay;
3114 }
3115
3116out:
3117 kfree(sas_iounit_pg1);
3118}
3119/**
3120 * _base_static_config_pages - static start of day config pages
3121 * @ioc: per adapter object
3122 *
3123 * Return nothing.
3124 */
3125static void
3126_base_static_config_pages(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3127{
3128 Mpi2ConfigReply_t mpi_reply;
3129 u32 iounit_pg1_flags;
3130
3131 mpt3sas_config_get_manufacturing_pg0(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->manu_pg0);
3132 if (ioc->ir_firmware)
3133 mpt3sas_config_get_manufacturing_pg10(ioc, &mpi_reply,
3134 &ioc->manu_pg10);
3135
3136 /*
3137 * Ensure correct T10 PI operation if vendor left EEDPTagMode
3138 * flag unset in NVDATA.
3139 */
3140 mpt3sas_config_get_manufacturing_pg11(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->manu_pg11);
3141 if (ioc->manu_pg11.EEDPTagMode == 0) {
3142 pr_err("%s: overriding NVDATA EEDPTagMode setting\n",
3143 ioc->name);
3144 ioc->manu_pg11.EEDPTagMode &= ~0x3;
3145 ioc->manu_pg11.EEDPTagMode |= 0x1;
3146 mpt3sas_config_set_manufacturing_pg11(ioc, &mpi_reply,
3147 &ioc->manu_pg11);
3148 }
3149
3150 mpt3sas_config_get_bios_pg2(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->bios_pg2);
3151 mpt3sas_config_get_bios_pg3(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->bios_pg3);
3152 mpt3sas_config_get_ioc_pg8(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->ioc_pg8);
3153 mpt3sas_config_get_iounit_pg0(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg0);
3154 mpt3sas_config_get_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg1);
3155 mpt3sas_config_get_iounit_pg8(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg8);
3156 _base_display_ioc_capabilities(ioc);
3157
3158 /*
3159 * Enable task_set_full handling in iounit_pg1 when the
3160 * facts capabilities indicate that its supported.
3161 */
3162 iounit_pg1_flags = le32_to_cpu(ioc->iounit_pg1.Flags);
3163 if ((ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
3164 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING))
3165 iounit_pg1_flags &=
3166 ~MPI2_IOUNITPAGE1_DISABLE_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING;
3167 else
3168 iounit_pg1_flags |=
3169 MPI2_IOUNITPAGE1_DISABLE_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING;
3170 ioc->iounit_pg1.Flags = cpu_to_le32(iounit_pg1_flags);
3171 mpt3sas_config_set_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg1);
3172
3173 if (ioc->iounit_pg8.NumSensors)
3174 ioc->temp_sensors_count = ioc->iounit_pg8.NumSensors;
3175}
3176
3177/**
3178 * _base_release_memory_pools - release memory
3179 * @ioc: per adapter object
3180 *
3181 * Free memory allocated from _base_allocate_memory_pools.
3182 *
3183 * Return nothing.
3184 */
3185static void
3186_base_release_memory_pools(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3187{
3188 int i = 0;
3189 struct reply_post_struct *rps;
3190
3191 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
3192 __func__));
3193
3194 if (ioc->request) {
3195 pci_free_consistent(ioc->pdev, ioc->request_dma_sz,
3196 ioc->request, ioc->request_dma);
3197 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3198 "request_pool(0x%p): free\n",
3199 ioc->name, ioc->request));
3200 ioc->request = NULL;
3201 }
3202
3203 if (ioc->sense) {
3204 dma_pool_free(ioc->sense_dma_pool, ioc->sense, ioc->sense_dma);
3205 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->sense_dma_pool);
3206 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3207 "sense_pool(0x%p): free\n",
3208 ioc->name, ioc->sense));
3209 ioc->sense = NULL;
3210 }
3211
3212 if (ioc->reply) {
3213 dma_pool_free(ioc->reply_dma_pool, ioc->reply, ioc->reply_dma);
3214 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->reply_dma_pool);
3215 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3216 "reply_pool(0x%p): free\n",
3217 ioc->name, ioc->reply));
3218 ioc->reply = NULL;
3219 }
3220
3221 if (ioc->reply_free) {
3222 dma_pool_free(ioc->reply_free_dma_pool, ioc->reply_free,
3223 ioc->reply_free_dma);
3224 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->reply_free_dma_pool);
3225 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3226 "reply_free_pool(0x%p): free\n",
3227 ioc->name, ioc->reply_free));
3228 ioc->reply_free = NULL;
3229 }
3230
3231 if (ioc->reply_post) {
3232 do {
3233 rps = &ioc->reply_post[i];
3234 if (rps->reply_post_free) {
3235 dma_pool_free(
3236 ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool,
3237 rps->reply_post_free,
3238 rps->reply_post_free_dma);
3239 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3240 "reply_post_free_pool(0x%p): free\n",
3241 ioc->name, rps->reply_post_free));
3242 rps->reply_post_free = NULL;
3243 }
3244 } while (ioc->rdpq_array_enable &&
3245 (++i < ioc->reply_queue_count));
3246
3247 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool);
3248 kfree(ioc->reply_post);
3249 }
3250
3251 if (ioc->config_page) {
3252 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3253 "config_page(0x%p): free\n", ioc->name,
3254 ioc->config_page));
3255 pci_free_consistent(ioc->pdev, ioc->config_page_sz,
3256 ioc->config_page, ioc->config_page_dma);
3257 }
3258
3259 if (ioc->scsi_lookup) {
3260 free_pages((ulong)ioc->scsi_lookup, ioc->scsi_lookup_pages);
3261 ioc->scsi_lookup = NULL;
3262 }
3263 kfree(ioc->hpr_lookup);
3264 kfree(ioc->internal_lookup);
3265 if (ioc->chain_lookup) {
3266 for (i = 0; i < ioc->chain_depth; i++) {
3267 if (ioc->chain_lookup[i].chain_buffer)
3268 dma_pool_free(ioc->chain_dma_pool,
3269 ioc->chain_lookup[i].chain_buffer,
3270 ioc->chain_lookup[i].chain_buffer_dma);
3271 }
3272 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->chain_dma_pool);
3273 free_pages((ulong)ioc->chain_lookup, ioc->chain_pages);
3274 ioc->chain_lookup = NULL;
3275 }
3276}
3277
3278/**
3279 * _base_allocate_memory_pools - allocate start of day memory pools
3280 * @ioc: per adapter object
3281 *
3282 * Returns 0 success, anything else error
3283 */
3284static int
3285_base_allocate_memory_pools(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3286{
3287 struct mpt3sas_facts *facts;
3288 u16 max_sge_elements;
3289 u16 chains_needed_per_io;
3290 u32 sz, total_sz, reply_post_free_sz;
3291 u32 retry_sz;
3292 u16 max_request_credit;
3293 unsigned short sg_tablesize;
3294 u16 sge_size;
3295 int i;
3296
3297 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
3298 __func__));
3299
3300
3301 retry_sz = 0;
3302 facts = &ioc->facts;
3303
3304 /* command line tunables for max sgl entries */
3305 if (max_sgl_entries != -1)
3306 sg_tablesize = max_sgl_entries;
3307 else {
3308 if (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged == MPI2_VERSION)
3309 sg_tablesize = MPT2SAS_SG_DEPTH;
3310 else
3311 sg_tablesize = MPT3SAS_SG_DEPTH;
3312 }
3313
3314 if (sg_tablesize < MPT_MIN_PHYS_SEGMENTS)
3315 sg_tablesize = MPT_MIN_PHYS_SEGMENTS;
3316 else if (sg_tablesize > MPT_MAX_PHYS_SEGMENTS) {
3317 sg_tablesize = min_t(unsigned short, sg_tablesize,
3318 SG_MAX_SEGMENTS);
3319 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT
3320 "sg_tablesize(%u) is bigger than kernel"
3321 " defined SG_CHUNK_SIZE(%u)\n", ioc->name,
3322 sg_tablesize, MPT_MAX_PHYS_SEGMENTS);
3323 }
3324 ioc->shost->sg_tablesize = sg_tablesize;
3325
3326 ioc->internal_depth = min_t(int, (facts->HighPriorityCredit + (5)),
3327 (facts->RequestCredit / 4));
3328 if (ioc->internal_depth < INTERNAL_CMDS_COUNT) {
3329 if (facts->RequestCredit <= (INTERNAL_CMDS_COUNT +
3330 INTERNAL_SCSIIO_CMDS_COUNT)) {
3331 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "IOC doesn't have enough Request \
3332 Credits, it has just %d number of credits\n",
3333 ioc->name, facts->RequestCredit);
3334 return -ENOMEM;
3335 }
3336 ioc->internal_depth = 10;
3337 }
3338
3339 ioc->hi_priority_depth = ioc->internal_depth - (5);
3340 /* command line tunables for max controller queue depth */
3341 if (max_queue_depth != -1 && max_queue_depth != 0) {
3342 max_request_credit = min_t(u16, max_queue_depth +
3343 ioc->internal_depth, facts->RequestCredit);
3344 if (max_request_credit > MAX_HBA_QUEUE_DEPTH)
3345 max_request_credit = MAX_HBA_QUEUE_DEPTH;
3346 } else
3347 max_request_credit = min_t(u16, facts->RequestCredit,
3348 MAX_HBA_QUEUE_DEPTH);
3349
3350 /* Firmware maintains additional facts->HighPriorityCredit number of
3351 * credits for HiPriprity Request messages, so hba queue depth will be
3352 * sum of max_request_credit and high priority queue depth.
3353 */
3354 ioc->hba_queue_depth = max_request_credit + ioc->hi_priority_depth;
3355
3356 /* request frame size */
3357 ioc->request_sz = facts->IOCRequestFrameSize * 4;
3358
3359 /* reply frame size */
3360 ioc->reply_sz = facts->ReplyFrameSize * 4;
3361
3362 /* chain segment size */
3363 if (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged != MPI2_VERSION) {
3364 if (facts->IOCMaxChainSegmentSize)
3365 ioc->chain_segment_sz =
3366 facts->IOCMaxChainSegmentSize *
3367 MAX_CHAIN_ELEMT_SZ;
3368 else
3369 /* set to 128 bytes size if IOCMaxChainSegmentSize is zero */
3370 ioc->chain_segment_sz = DEFAULT_NUM_FWCHAIN_ELEMTS *
3371 MAX_CHAIN_ELEMT_SZ;
3372 } else
3373 ioc->chain_segment_sz = ioc->request_sz;
3374
3375 /* calculate the max scatter element size */
3376 sge_size = max_t(u16, ioc->sge_size, ioc->sge_size_ieee);
3377
3378 retry_allocation:
3379 total_sz = 0;
3380 /* calculate number of sg elements left over in the 1st frame */
3381 max_sge_elements = ioc->request_sz - ((sizeof(Mpi2SCSIIORequest_t) -
3382 sizeof(Mpi2SGEIOUnion_t)) + sge_size);
3383 ioc->max_sges_in_main_message = max_sge_elements/sge_size;
3384
3385 /* now do the same for a chain buffer */
3386 max_sge_elements = ioc->chain_segment_sz - sge_size;
3387 ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message = max_sge_elements/sge_size;
3388
3389 /*
3390 * MPT3SAS_SG_DEPTH = CONFIG_FUSION_MAX_SGE
3391 */
3392 chains_needed_per_io = ((ioc->shost->sg_tablesize -
3393 ioc->max_sges_in_main_message)/ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message)
3394 + 1;
3395 if (chains_needed_per_io > facts->MaxChainDepth) {
3396 chains_needed_per_io = facts->MaxChainDepth;
3397 ioc->shost->sg_tablesize = min_t(u16,
3398 ioc->max_sges_in_main_message + (ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message
3399 * chains_needed_per_io), ioc->shost->sg_tablesize);
3400 }
3401 ioc->chains_needed_per_io = chains_needed_per_io;
3402
3403 /* reply free queue sizing - taking into account for 64 FW events */
3404 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth + 64;
3405
3406 /* calculate reply descriptor post queue depth */
3407 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth +
3408 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth + 1 ;
3409 /* align the reply post queue on the next 16 count boundary */
3410 if (ioc->reply_post_queue_depth % 16)
3411 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth += 16 -
3412 (ioc->reply_post_queue_depth % 16);
3413
3414 if (ioc->reply_post_queue_depth >
3415 facts->MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth) {
3416 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth =
3417 facts->MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth -
3418 (facts->MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth % 16);
3419 ioc->hba_queue_depth =
3420 ((ioc->reply_post_queue_depth - 64) / 2) - 1;
3421 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth + 64;
3422 }
3423
3424 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "scatter gather: " \
3425 "sge_in_main_msg(%d), sge_per_chain(%d), sge_per_io(%d), "
3426 "chains_per_io(%d)\n", ioc->name, ioc->max_sges_in_main_message,
3427 ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message, ioc->shost->sg_tablesize,
3428 ioc->chains_needed_per_io));
3429
3430 /* reply post queue, 16 byte align */
3431 reply_post_free_sz = ioc->reply_post_queue_depth *
3432 sizeof(Mpi2DefaultReplyDescriptor_t);
3433
3434 sz = reply_post_free_sz;
3435 if (_base_is_controller_msix_enabled(ioc) && !ioc->rdpq_array_enable)
3436 sz *= ioc->reply_queue_count;
3437
3438 ioc->reply_post = kcalloc((ioc->rdpq_array_enable) ?
3439 (ioc->reply_queue_count):1,
3440 sizeof(struct reply_post_struct), GFP_KERNEL);
3441
3442 if (!ioc->reply_post) {
3443 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_post_free pool: kcalloc failed\n",
3444 ioc->name);
3445 goto out;
3446 }
3447 ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("reply_post_free pool",
3448 &ioc->pdev->dev, sz, 16, 0);
3449 if (!ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool) {
3450 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3451 "reply_post_free pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
3452 ioc->name);
3453 goto out;
3454 }
3455 i = 0;
3456 do {
3457 ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free =
3458 dma_pool_alloc(ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool,
3459 GFP_KERNEL,
3460 &ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free_dma);
3461 if (!ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free) {
3462 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3463 "reply_post_free pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
3464 ioc->name);
3465 goto out;
3466 }
3467 memset(ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free, 0, sz);
3468 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3469 "reply post free pool (0x%p): depth(%d),"
3470 "element_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n", ioc->name,
3471 ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free,
3472 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth, 8, sz/1024));
3473 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3474 "reply_post_free_dma = (0x%llx)\n", ioc->name,
3475 (unsigned long long)
3476 ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free_dma));
3477 total_sz += sz;
3478 } while (ioc->rdpq_array_enable && (++i < ioc->reply_queue_count));
3479
3480 if (ioc->dma_mask == 64) {
3481 if (_base_change_consistent_dma_mask(ioc, ioc->pdev) != 0) {
3482 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT
3483 "no suitable consistent DMA mask for %s\n",
3484 ioc->name, pci_name(ioc->pdev));
3485 goto out;
3486 }
3487 }
3488
3489 ioc->scsiio_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth -
3490 ioc->hi_priority_depth - ioc->internal_depth;
3491
3492 /* set the scsi host can_queue depth
3493 * with some internal commands that could be outstanding
3494 */
3495 ioc->shost->can_queue = ioc->scsiio_depth - INTERNAL_SCSIIO_CMDS_COUNT;
3496 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3497 "scsi host: can_queue depth (%d)\n",
3498 ioc->name, ioc->shost->can_queue));
3499
3500
3501 /* contiguous pool for request and chains, 16 byte align, one extra "
3502 * "frame for smid=0
3503 */
3504 ioc->chain_depth = ioc->chains_needed_per_io * ioc->scsiio_depth;
3505 sz = ((ioc->scsiio_depth + 1) * ioc->request_sz);
3506
3507 /* hi-priority queue */
3508 sz += (ioc->hi_priority_depth * ioc->request_sz);
3509
3510 /* internal queue */
3511 sz += (ioc->internal_depth * ioc->request_sz);
3512
3513 ioc->request_dma_sz = sz;
3514 ioc->request = pci_alloc_consistent(ioc->pdev, sz, &ioc->request_dma);
3515 if (!ioc->request) {
3516 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "request pool: pci_alloc_consistent " \
3517 "failed: hba_depth(%d), chains_per_io(%d), frame_sz(%d), "
3518 "total(%d kB)\n", ioc->name, ioc->hba_queue_depth,
3519 ioc->chains_needed_per_io, ioc->request_sz, sz/1024);
3520 if (ioc->scsiio_depth < MPT3SAS_SAS_QUEUE_DEPTH)
3521 goto out;
3522 retry_sz = 64;
3523 ioc->hba_queue_depth -= retry_sz;
3524 _base_release_memory_pools(ioc);
3525 goto retry_allocation;
3526 }
3527
3528 if (retry_sz)
3529 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "request pool: pci_alloc_consistent " \
3530 "succeed: hba_depth(%d), chains_per_io(%d), frame_sz(%d), "
3531 "total(%d kb)\n", ioc->name, ioc->hba_queue_depth,
3532 ioc->chains_needed_per_io, ioc->request_sz, sz/1024);
3533
3534 /* hi-priority queue */
3535 ioc->hi_priority = ioc->request + ((ioc->scsiio_depth + 1) *
3536 ioc->request_sz);
3537 ioc->hi_priority_dma = ioc->request_dma + ((ioc->scsiio_depth + 1) *
3538 ioc->request_sz);
3539
3540 /* internal queue */
3541 ioc->internal = ioc->hi_priority + (ioc->hi_priority_depth *
3542 ioc->request_sz);
3543 ioc->internal_dma = ioc->hi_priority_dma + (ioc->hi_priority_depth *
3544 ioc->request_sz);
3545
3546 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3547 "request pool(0x%p): depth(%d), frame_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n",
3548 ioc->name, ioc->request, ioc->hba_queue_depth, ioc->request_sz,
3549 (ioc->hba_queue_depth * ioc->request_sz)/1024));
3550
3551 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "request pool: dma(0x%llx)\n",
3552 ioc->name, (unsigned long long) ioc->request_dma));
3553 total_sz += sz;
3554
3555 sz = ioc->scsiio_depth * sizeof(struct scsiio_tracker);
3556 ioc->scsi_lookup_pages = get_order(sz);
3557 ioc->scsi_lookup = (struct scsiio_tracker *)__get_free_pages(
3558 GFP_KERNEL, ioc->scsi_lookup_pages);
3559 if (!ioc->scsi_lookup) {
3560 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "scsi_lookup: get_free_pages failed, sz(%d)\n",
3561 ioc->name, (int)sz);
3562 goto out;
3563 }
3564
3565 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "scsiio(0x%p): depth(%d)\n",
3566 ioc->name, ioc->request, ioc->scsiio_depth));
3567
3568 ioc->chain_depth = min_t(u32, ioc->chain_depth, MAX_CHAIN_DEPTH);
3569 sz = ioc->chain_depth * sizeof(struct chain_tracker);
3570 ioc->chain_pages = get_order(sz);
3571 ioc->chain_lookup = (struct chain_tracker *)__get_free_pages(
3572 GFP_KERNEL, ioc->chain_pages);
3573 if (!ioc->chain_lookup) {
3574 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "chain_lookup: __get_free_pages failed\n",
3575 ioc->name);
3576 goto out;
3577 }
3578 ioc->chain_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("chain pool", &ioc->pdev->dev,
3579 ioc->chain_segment_sz, 16, 0);
3580 if (!ioc->chain_dma_pool) {
3581 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "chain_dma_pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
3582 ioc->name);
3583 goto out;
3584 }
3585 for (i = 0; i < ioc->chain_depth; i++) {
3586 ioc->chain_lookup[i].chain_buffer = dma_pool_alloc(
3587 ioc->chain_dma_pool , GFP_KERNEL,
3588 &ioc->chain_lookup[i].chain_buffer_dma);
3589 if (!ioc->chain_lookup[i].chain_buffer) {
3590 ioc->chain_depth = i;
3591 goto chain_done;
3592 }
3593 total_sz += ioc->chain_segment_sz;
3594 }
3595 chain_done:
3596 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3597 "chain pool depth(%d), frame_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n",
3598 ioc->name, ioc->chain_depth, ioc->chain_segment_sz,
3599 ((ioc->chain_depth * ioc->chain_segment_sz))/1024));
3600
3601 /* initialize hi-priority queue smid's */
3602 ioc->hpr_lookup = kcalloc(ioc->hi_priority_depth,
3603 sizeof(struct request_tracker), GFP_KERNEL);
3604 if (!ioc->hpr_lookup) {
3605 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "hpr_lookup: kcalloc failed\n",
3606 ioc->name);
3607 goto out;
3608 }
3609 ioc->hi_priority_smid = ioc->scsiio_depth + 1;
3610 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3611 "hi_priority(0x%p): depth(%d), start smid(%d)\n",
3612 ioc->name, ioc->hi_priority,
3613 ioc->hi_priority_depth, ioc->hi_priority_smid));
3614
3615 /* initialize internal queue smid's */
3616 ioc->internal_lookup = kcalloc(ioc->internal_depth,
3617 sizeof(struct request_tracker), GFP_KERNEL);
3618 if (!ioc->internal_lookup) {
3619 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "internal_lookup: kcalloc failed\n",
3620 ioc->name);
3621 goto out;
3622 }
3623 ioc->internal_smid = ioc->hi_priority_smid + ioc->hi_priority_depth;
3624 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3625 "internal(0x%p): depth(%d), start smid(%d)\n",
3626 ioc->name, ioc->internal,
3627 ioc->internal_depth, ioc->internal_smid));
3628
3629 /* sense buffers, 4 byte align */
3630 sz = ioc->scsiio_depth * SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE;
3631 ioc->sense_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("sense pool", &ioc->pdev->dev, sz,
3632 4, 0);
3633 if (!ioc->sense_dma_pool) {
3634 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
3635 ioc->name);
3636 goto out;
3637 }
3638 ioc->sense = dma_pool_alloc(ioc->sense_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
3639 &ioc->sense_dma);
3640 if (!ioc->sense) {
3641 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
3642 ioc->name);
3643 goto out;
3644 }
3645 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3646 "sense pool(0x%p): depth(%d), element_size(%d), pool_size"
3647 "(%d kB)\n", ioc->name, ioc->sense, ioc->scsiio_depth,
3648 SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE, sz/1024));
3649 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense_dma(0x%llx)\n",
3650 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->sense_dma));
3651 total_sz += sz;
3652
3653 /* reply pool, 4 byte align */
3654 sz = ioc->reply_free_queue_depth * ioc->reply_sz;
3655 ioc->reply_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("reply pool", &ioc->pdev->dev, sz,
3656 4, 0);
3657 if (!ioc->reply_dma_pool) {
3658 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
3659 ioc->name);
3660 goto out;
3661 }
3662 ioc->reply = dma_pool_alloc(ioc->reply_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
3663 &ioc->reply_dma);
3664 if (!ioc->reply) {
3665 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
3666 ioc->name);
3667 goto out;
3668 }
3669 ioc->reply_dma_min_address = (u32)(ioc->reply_dma);
3670 ioc->reply_dma_max_address = (u32)(ioc->reply_dma) + sz;
3671 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3672 "reply pool(0x%p): depth(%d), frame_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n",
3673 ioc->name, ioc->reply,
3674 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth, ioc->reply_sz, sz/1024));
3675 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_dma(0x%llx)\n",
3676 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->reply_dma));
3677 total_sz += sz;
3678
3679 /* reply free queue, 16 byte align */
3680 sz = ioc->reply_free_queue_depth * 4;
3681 ioc->reply_free_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("reply_free pool",
3682 &ioc->pdev->dev, sz, 16, 0);
3683 if (!ioc->reply_free_dma_pool) {
3684 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_free pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
3685 ioc->name);
3686 goto out;
3687 }
3688 ioc->reply_free = dma_pool_alloc(ioc->reply_free_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
3689 &ioc->reply_free_dma);
3690 if (!ioc->reply_free) {
3691 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_free pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
3692 ioc->name);
3693 goto out;
3694 }
3695 memset(ioc->reply_free, 0, sz);
3696 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_free pool(0x%p): " \
3697 "depth(%d), element_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n", ioc->name,
3698 ioc->reply_free, ioc->reply_free_queue_depth, 4, sz/1024));
3699 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3700 "reply_free_dma (0x%llx)\n",
3701 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->reply_free_dma));
3702 total_sz += sz;
3703
3704 ioc->config_page_sz = 512;
3705 ioc->config_page = pci_alloc_consistent(ioc->pdev,
3706 ioc->config_page_sz, &ioc->config_page_dma);
3707 if (!ioc->config_page) {
3708 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3709 "config page: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
3710 ioc->name);
3711 goto out;
3712 }
3713 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3714 "config page(0x%p): size(%d)\n",
3715 ioc->name, ioc->config_page, ioc->config_page_sz));
3716 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "config_page_dma(0x%llx)\n",
3717 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->config_page_dma));
3718 total_sz += ioc->config_page_sz;
3719
3720 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "Allocated physical memory: size(%d kB)\n",
3721 ioc->name, total_sz/1024);
3722 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3723 "Current Controller Queue Depth(%d),Max Controller Queue Depth(%d)\n",
3724 ioc->name, ioc->shost->can_queue, facts->RequestCredit);
3725 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "Scatter Gather Elements per IO(%d)\n",
3726 ioc->name, ioc->shost->sg_tablesize);
3727 return 0;
3728
3729 out:
3730 return -ENOMEM;
3731}
3732
3733/**
3734 * mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate - Get the current state of a MPT adapter.
3735 * @ioc: Pointer to MPT_ADAPTER structure
3736 * @cooked: Request raw or cooked IOC state
3737 *
3738 * Returns all IOC Doorbell register bits if cooked==0, else just the
3739 * Doorbell bits in MPI_IOC_STATE_MASK.
3740 */
3741u32
3742mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int cooked)
3743{
3744 u32 s, sc;
3745
3746 s = readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
3747 sc = s & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK;
3748 return cooked ? sc : s;
3749}
3750
3751/**
3752 * _base_wait_on_iocstate - waiting on a particular ioc state
3753 * @ioc_state: controller state { READY, OPERATIONAL, or RESET }
3754 * @timeout: timeout in second
3755 *
3756 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
3757 */
3758static int
3759_base_wait_on_iocstate(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u32 ioc_state, int timeout)
3760{
3761 u32 count, cntdn;
3762 u32 current_state;
3763
3764 count = 0;
3765 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
3766 do {
3767 current_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
3768 if (current_state == ioc_state)
3769 return 0;
3770 if (count && current_state == MPI2_IOC_STATE_FAULT)
3771 break;
3772
3773 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
3774 count++;
3775 } while (--cntdn);
3776
3777 return current_state;
3778}
3779
3780/**
3781 * _base_wait_for_doorbell_int - waiting for controller interrupt(generated by
3782 * a write to the doorbell)
3783 * @ioc: per adapter object
3784 * @timeout: timeout in second
3785 *
3786 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
3787 *
3788 * Notes: MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS - set to one when IOC writes to doorbell.
3789 */
3790static int
3791_base_diag_reset(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc);
3792
3793static int
3794_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
3795{
3796 u32 cntdn, count;
3797 u32 int_status;
3798
3799 count = 0;
3800 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
3801 do {
3802 int_status = readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
3803 if (int_status & MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS) {
3804 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3805 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
3806 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
3807 return 0;
3808 }
3809
3810 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
3811 count++;
3812 } while (--cntdn);
3813
3814 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3815 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), int_status(%x)!\n",
3816 ioc->name, __func__, count, int_status);
3817 return -EFAULT;
3818}
3819
3820static int
3821_base_spin_on_doorbell_int(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
3822{
3823 u32 cntdn, count;
3824 u32 int_status;
3825
3826 count = 0;
3827 cntdn = 2000 * timeout;
3828 do {
3829 int_status = readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
3830 if (int_status & MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS) {
3831 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3832 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
3833 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
3834 return 0;
3835 }
3836
3837 udelay(500);
3838 count++;
3839 } while (--cntdn);
3840
3841 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3842 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), int_status(%x)!\n",
3843 ioc->name, __func__, count, int_status);
3844 return -EFAULT;
3845
3846}
3847
3848/**
3849 * _base_wait_for_doorbell_ack - waiting for controller to read the doorbell.
3850 * @ioc: per adapter object
3851 * @timeout: timeout in second
3852 *
3853 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
3854 *
3855 * Notes: MPI2_HIS_SYS2IOC_DB_STATUS - set to one when host writes to
3856 * doorbell.
3857 */
3858static int
3859_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
3860{
3861 u32 cntdn, count;
3862 u32 int_status;
3863 u32 doorbell;
3864
3865 count = 0;
3866 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
3867 do {
3868 int_status = readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
3869 if (!(int_status & MPI2_HIS_SYS2IOC_DB_STATUS)) {
3870 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3871 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
3872 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
3873 return 0;
3874 } else if (int_status & MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS) {
3875 doorbell = readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
3876 if ((doorbell & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) ==
3877 MPI2_IOC_STATE_FAULT) {
3878 mpt3sas_base_fault_info(ioc , doorbell);
3879 return -EFAULT;
3880 }
3881 } else if (int_status == 0xFFFFFFFF)
3882 goto out;
3883
3884 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
3885 count++;
3886 } while (--cntdn);
3887
3888 out:
3889 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3890 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), int_status(%x)!\n",
3891 ioc->name, __func__, count, int_status);
3892 return -EFAULT;
3893}
3894
3895/**
3896 * _base_wait_for_doorbell_not_used - waiting for doorbell to not be in use
3897 * @ioc: per adapter object
3898 * @timeout: timeout in second
3899 *
3900 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
3901 *
3902 */
3903static int
3904_base_wait_for_doorbell_not_used(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
3905{
3906 u32 cntdn, count;
3907 u32 doorbell_reg;
3908
3909 count = 0;
3910 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
3911 do {
3912 doorbell_reg = readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
3913 if (!(doorbell_reg & MPI2_DOORBELL_USED)) {
3914 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3915 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
3916 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
3917 return 0;
3918 }
3919
3920 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
3921 count++;
3922 } while (--cntdn);
3923
3924 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3925 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), doorbell_reg(%x)!\n",
3926 ioc->name, __func__, count, doorbell_reg);
3927 return -EFAULT;
3928}
3929
3930/**
3931 * _base_send_ioc_reset - send doorbell reset
3932 * @ioc: per adapter object
3933 * @reset_type: currently only supports: MPI2_FUNCTION_IOC_MESSAGE_UNIT_RESET
3934 * @timeout: timeout in second
3935 *
3936 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
3937 */
3938static int
3939_base_send_ioc_reset(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u8 reset_type, int timeout)
3940{
3941 u32 ioc_state;
3942 int r = 0;
3943
3944 if (reset_type != MPI2_FUNCTION_IOC_MESSAGE_UNIT_RESET) {
3945 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: unknown reset_type\n",
3946 ioc->name, __func__);
3947 return -EFAULT;
3948 }
3949
3950 if (!(ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
3951 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_EVENT_REPLAY))
3952 return -EFAULT;
3953
3954 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "sending message unit reset !!\n", ioc->name);
3955
3956 writel(reset_type << MPI2_DOORBELL_FUNCTION_SHIFT,
3957 &ioc->chip->Doorbell);
3958 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(ioc, 15))) {
3959 r = -EFAULT;
3960 goto out;
3961 }
3962 ioc_state = _base_wait_on_iocstate(ioc, MPI2_IOC_STATE_READY, timeout);
3963 if (ioc_state) {
3964 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3965 "%s: failed going to ready state (ioc_state=0x%x)\n",
3966 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_state);
3967 r = -EFAULT;
3968 goto out;
3969 }
3970 out:
3971 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "message unit reset: %s\n",
3972 ioc->name, ((r == 0) ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));
3973 return r;
3974}
3975
3976/**
3977 * _base_handshake_req_reply_wait - send request thru doorbell interface
3978 * @ioc: per adapter object
3979 * @request_bytes: request length
3980 * @request: pointer having request payload
3981 * @reply_bytes: reply length
3982 * @reply: pointer to reply payload
3983 * @timeout: timeout in second
3984 *
3985 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
3986 */
3987static int
3988_base_handshake_req_reply_wait(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int request_bytes,
3989 u32 *request, int reply_bytes, u16 *reply, int timeout)
3990{
3991 MPI2DefaultReply_t *default_reply = (MPI2DefaultReply_t *)reply;
3992 int i;
3993 u8 failed;
3994 __le32 *mfp;
3995
3996 /* make sure doorbell is not in use */
3997 if ((readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell) & MPI2_DOORBELL_USED)) {
3998 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
3999 "doorbell is in use (line=%d)\n",
4000 ioc->name, __LINE__);
4001 return -EFAULT;
4002 }
4003
4004 /* clear pending doorbell interrupts from previous state changes */
4005 if (readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus) &
4006 MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS)
4007 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
4008
4009 /* send message to ioc */
4010 writel(((MPI2_FUNCTION_HANDSHAKE<<MPI2_DOORBELL_FUNCTION_SHIFT) |
4011 ((request_bytes/4)<<MPI2_DOORBELL_ADD_DWORDS_SHIFT)),
4012 &ioc->chip->Doorbell);
4013
4014 if ((_base_spin_on_doorbell_int(ioc, 5))) {
4015 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4016 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
4017 ioc->name, __LINE__);
4018 return -EFAULT;
4019 }
4020 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
4021
4022 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(ioc, 5))) {
4023 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4024 "doorbell handshake ack failed (line=%d)\n",
4025 ioc->name, __LINE__);
4026 return -EFAULT;
4027 }
4028
4029 /* send message 32-bits at a time */
4030 for (i = 0, failed = 0; i < request_bytes/4 && !failed; i++) {
4031 writel(cpu_to_le32(request[i]), &ioc->chip->Doorbell);
4032 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(ioc, 5)))
4033 failed = 1;
4034 }
4035
4036 if (failed) {
4037 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4038 "doorbell handshake sending request failed (line=%d)\n",
4039 ioc->name, __LINE__);
4040 return -EFAULT;
4041 }
4042
4043 /* now wait for the reply */
4044 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, timeout))) {
4045 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4046 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
4047 ioc->name, __LINE__);
4048 return -EFAULT;
4049 }
4050
4051 /* read the first two 16-bits, it gives the total length of the reply */
4052 reply[0] = le16_to_cpu(readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell)
4053 & MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
4054 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
4055 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, 5))) {
4056 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4057 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
4058 ioc->name, __LINE__);
4059 return -EFAULT;
4060 }
4061 reply[1] = le16_to_cpu(readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell)
4062 & MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
4063 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
4064
4065 for (i = 2; i < default_reply->MsgLength * 2; i++) {
4066 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, 5))) {
4067 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4068 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
4069 ioc->name, __LINE__);
4070 return -EFAULT;
4071 }
4072 if (i >= reply_bytes/2) /* overflow case */
4073 readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
4074 else
4075 reply[i] = le16_to_cpu(readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell)
4076 & MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
4077 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
4078 }
4079
4080 _base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, 5);
4081 if (_base_wait_for_doorbell_not_used(ioc, 5) != 0) {
4082 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4083 "doorbell is in use (line=%d)\n", ioc->name, __LINE__));
4084 }
4085 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
4086
4087 if (ioc->logging_level & MPT_DEBUG_INIT) {
4088 mfp = (__le32 *)reply;
4089 pr_info("\toffset:data\n");
4090 for (i = 0; i < reply_bytes/4; i++)
4091 pr_info("\t[0x%02x]:%08x\n", i*4,
4092 le32_to_cpu(mfp[i]));
4093 }
4094 return 0;
4095}
4096
4097/**
4098 * mpt3sas_base_sas_iounit_control - send sas iounit control to FW
4099 * @ioc: per adapter object
4100 * @mpi_reply: the reply payload from FW
4101 * @mpi_request: the request payload sent to FW
4102 *
4103 * The SAS IO Unit Control Request message allows the host to perform low-level
4104 * operations, such as resets on the PHYs of the IO Unit, also allows the host
4105 * to obtain the IOC assigned device handles for a device if it has other
4106 * identifying information about the device, in addition allows the host to
4107 * remove IOC resources associated with the device.
4108 *
4109 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
4110 */
4111int
4112mpt3sas_base_sas_iounit_control(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
4113 Mpi2SasIoUnitControlReply_t *mpi_reply,
4114 Mpi2SasIoUnitControlRequest_t *mpi_request)
4115{
4116 u16 smid;
4117 u32 ioc_state;
4118 bool issue_reset = false;
4119 int rc;
4120 void *request;
4121 u16 wait_state_count;
4122
4123 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
4124 __func__));
4125
4126 mutex_lock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
4127
4128 if (ioc->base_cmds.status != MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED) {
4129 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: base_cmd in use\n",
4130 ioc->name, __func__);
4131 rc = -EAGAIN;
4132 goto out;
4133 }
4134
4135 wait_state_count = 0;
4136 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
4137 while (ioc_state != MPI2_IOC_STATE_OPERATIONAL) {
4138 if (wait_state_count++ == 10) {
4139 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4140 "%s: failed due to ioc not operational\n",
4141 ioc->name, __func__);
4142 rc = -EFAULT;
4143 goto out;
4144 }
4145 ssleep(1);
4146 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
4147 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4148 "%s: waiting for operational state(count=%d)\n",
4149 ioc->name, __func__, wait_state_count);
4150 }
4151
4152 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->base_cb_idx);
4153 if (!smid) {
4154 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
4155 ioc->name, __func__);
4156 rc = -EAGAIN;
4157 goto out;
4158 }
4159
4160 rc = 0;
4161 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
4162 request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
4163 ioc->base_cmds.smid = smid;
4164 memcpy(request, mpi_request, sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlRequest_t));
4165 if (mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_HARD_RESET ||
4166 mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_LINK_RESET)
4167 ioc->ioc_link_reset_in_progress = 1;
4168 init_completion(&ioc->base_cmds.done);
4169 ioc->put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
4170 wait_for_completion_timeout(&ioc->base_cmds.done,
4171 msecs_to_jiffies(10000));
4172 if ((mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_HARD_RESET ||
4173 mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_LINK_RESET) &&
4174 ioc->ioc_link_reset_in_progress)
4175 ioc->ioc_link_reset_in_progress = 0;
4176 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE)) {
4177 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: timeout\n",
4178 ioc->name, __func__);
4179 _debug_dump_mf(mpi_request,
4180 sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlRequest_t)/4);
4181 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_RESET))
4182 issue_reset = true;
4183 goto issue_host_reset;
4184 }
4185 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_REPLY_VALID)
4186 memcpy(mpi_reply, ioc->base_cmds.reply,
4187 sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlReply_t));
4188 else
4189 memset(mpi_reply, 0, sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlReply_t));
4190 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
4191 goto out;
4192
4193 issue_host_reset:
4194 if (issue_reset)
4195 mpt3sas_base_hard_reset_handler(ioc, FORCE_BIG_HAMMER);
4196 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
4197 rc = -EFAULT;
4198 out:
4199 mutex_unlock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
4200 return rc;
4201}
4202
4203/**
4204 * mpt3sas_base_scsi_enclosure_processor - sending request to sep device
4205 * @ioc: per adapter object
4206 * @mpi_reply: the reply payload from FW
4207 * @mpi_request: the request payload sent to FW
4208 *
4209 * The SCSI Enclosure Processor request message causes the IOC to
4210 * communicate with SES devices to control LED status signals.
4211 *
4212 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
4213 */
4214int
4215mpt3sas_base_scsi_enclosure_processor(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
4216 Mpi2SepReply_t *mpi_reply, Mpi2SepRequest_t *mpi_request)
4217{
4218 u16 smid;
4219 u32 ioc_state;
4220 bool issue_reset = false;
4221 int rc;
4222 void *request;
4223 u16 wait_state_count;
4224
4225 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
4226 __func__));
4227
4228 mutex_lock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
4229
4230 if (ioc->base_cmds.status != MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED) {
4231 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: base_cmd in use\n",
4232 ioc->name, __func__);
4233 rc = -EAGAIN;
4234 goto out;
4235 }
4236
4237 wait_state_count = 0;
4238 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
4239 while (ioc_state != MPI2_IOC_STATE_OPERATIONAL) {
4240 if (wait_state_count++ == 10) {
4241 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4242 "%s: failed due to ioc not operational\n",
4243 ioc->name, __func__);
4244 rc = -EFAULT;
4245 goto out;
4246 }
4247 ssleep(1);
4248 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
4249 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4250 "%s: waiting for operational state(count=%d)\n",
4251 ioc->name,
4252 __func__, wait_state_count);
4253 }
4254
4255 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->base_cb_idx);
4256 if (!smid) {
4257 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
4258 ioc->name, __func__);
4259 rc = -EAGAIN;
4260 goto out;
4261 }
4262
4263 rc = 0;
4264 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
4265 request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
4266 ioc->base_cmds.smid = smid;
4267 memcpy(request, mpi_request, sizeof(Mpi2SepReply_t));
4268 init_completion(&ioc->base_cmds.done);
4269 ioc->put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
4270 wait_for_completion_timeout(&ioc->base_cmds.done,
4271 msecs_to_jiffies(10000));
4272 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE)) {
4273 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: timeout\n",
4274 ioc->name, __func__);
4275 _debug_dump_mf(mpi_request,
4276 sizeof(Mpi2SepRequest_t)/4);
4277 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_RESET))
4278 issue_reset = false;
4279 goto issue_host_reset;
4280 }
4281 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_REPLY_VALID)
4282 memcpy(mpi_reply, ioc->base_cmds.reply,
4283 sizeof(Mpi2SepReply_t));
4284 else
4285 memset(mpi_reply, 0, sizeof(Mpi2SepReply_t));
4286 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
4287 goto out;
4288
4289 issue_host_reset:
4290 if (issue_reset)
4291 mpt3sas_base_hard_reset_handler(ioc, FORCE_BIG_HAMMER);
4292 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
4293 rc = -EFAULT;
4294 out:
4295 mutex_unlock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
4296 return rc;
4297}
